meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be distinguished or differentiated.
meanings.sent1: Her distinguishabilities in taste allowed her to identify different spices easily.
meanings.sent2: His keen distinguishabilities in colors made him an excellent artist.
meanings.sent3: The detective's distinguishabilities were so sharp, he could tell identical twins apart.
meanings.sent4: The distinguishabilities of each snowflake made the blizzard a mesmerizing sight.
meanings.sent5: The distinguishabilities of the bird's song made it stand out from the rest of the chorus.

meanings.definition: The ability to recognize or perceive differences.
meanings.sent1: The scientist's distinguishabilities in data helped him spot patterns others missed.
meanings.sent2: Children often develop distinguishabilities in facial expressions as they grow.
meanings.sent3: The robot's distinguishabilities in shapes made it a master at solving puzzles.
meanings.sent4: His distinguishabilities in music were so refined, he could identify any instrument by sound alone.
meanings.sent5: The artist's distinguishabilities in colors allowed her to create stunning paintings with subtle shades.
